com.swoval.files

Class AppleDirectoryWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swoval.files.DirectoryWatcher
      • com.swoval.files.AppleDirectoryWatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class AppleDirectoryWatcher
extends DirectoryWatcher
    Implements the DirectoryWatcher for Mac OSX using the Apple File System Events Api

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AppleDirectoryWatcher(Consumer<DirectoryWatcher.Event> onFileEvent, Executor executor, com.swoval.files.DirectoryRegistry directoryRegistry, DirectoryWatcher.Option... options) 
      AppleDirectoryWatcher(double latency, Flags.Create flags, Executor callbackExecutor, Consumer<DirectoryWatcher.Event> onFileEvent, Consumer<java.lang.String> onStreamRemoved, Executor executor, com.swoval.files.DirectoryRegistry directoryRegistry)
      Creates a new AppleDirectoryWatcher which is a wrapper around FileEventsApi, which in turn is a native wrapper around Apple File System Events

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppleDirectoryWatcher

        public AppleDirectoryWatcher(Consumer<DirectoryWatcher.Event> onFileEvent,
                             Executor executor,
                             com.swoval.files.DirectoryRegistry directoryRegistry,
                             DirectoryWatcher.Option... options)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • AppleDirectoryWatcher

        public AppleDirectoryWatcher(double latency,
                             Flags.Create flags,
                             Executor callbackExecutor,
                             Consumer<DirectoryWatcher.Event> onFileEvent,
                             Consumer<java.lang.String> onStreamRemoved,
                             Executor executor,
                             com.swoval.files.DirectoryRegistry directoryRegistry)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Creates a new AppleDirectoryWatcher which is a wrapper around FileEventsApi, which in turn is a native wrapper around Apple File System Events
        Parameters:
        latency - specified in fractional seconds
        flags - Native flags
        callbackExecutor - Executor to run callbacks on
        onFileEvent - Consumer to run on file events
        onStreamRemoved - Consumer to run when a redundant stream is removed from the underlying native file events implementation
        executor - The internal executor to manage the directory watcher state
        directoryRegistry - The registry of directories to monitor
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the native file events implementation is interrupted during initialization

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public Either<java.io.IOException,java.lang.Boolean> register(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                                              int maxDepth)
        Registers a path
        Specified by:
        register in class DirectoryWatcher
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to watch for file events
        maxDepth - The maximum number of subdirectory levels to visit
        Returns:
        an Either containing the result of the registration or an IOException if registration fails. This method should be idempotent and return true the first time the directory is registered or when the depth is changed. Otherwise it should return false.

      • register

        public Either<java.io.IOException,java.lang.Boolean> register(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                                              Flags.Create flags,
                                                              int maxDepth)
        Registers with additional flags
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to watch for file events
        flags - The flags Flags.Create to set for the directory
        maxDepth - The maximum number of subdirectory levels to visit
        Returns:
        an Either containing the result of the registration or an IOException if registration fails. This method should be idempotent and return true the first time the directory is registered or when the depth is changed. Otherwise it should return false.

      • unregister

        public void unregister(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Unregisters a path
        Specified by:
        unregister in class DirectoryWatcher
        Parameters:
        path - The directory to remove from monitoring

        public void close()
        Closes the FileEventsApi and shuts down the callbackExecutor.

        Overrides:
